title: B-convex space
summary: In functional analysis, the class of B-convex spaces is a class of Banach space.  The concept of B-convexity was defined and used to characterize Banach spaces that have the strong law of large numbers by Anatole Beck in 1962;  accordingly, "B-convexity" is understood as an abbreviation of Beck convexity.  Beck proved the following theorem: A Banach space is B-convex if and only if every sequence of independent, symmetric, uniformly bounded and Radon random variables in that space satisfies the strong law of large numbers.
